notes.description: Notes added to the LDAP/Rover group

Configuration for github-repo-invites integration.
Currently contains information for fetching the
token of the github app-sre bot for accepting
invitations to repositories.

the blackbox exporter modules that can be used for /dependencies/endpoint-monitoring-provider-1.yml#blackboxExporter.module
if none are listed, no restrictions apply

cloudflareEmailDomainAllowList.description: Email domain allow list restricts user with specific email domain to get access to Cloudflare systems

customMessages.description: custom messages to be used in integrations

terraformResourcesProviderExclusions.description:
Object to hold provisioner exclusions by provider.
e.g: RDS is not managed by terraform-resources on app-sre-stage.
The use-case is the Erv2 resources migration

terraformResourcesProviderExclusionsByPr.description: deprecated object. Just here to rollout new changes

priority.description: influence order in which merge requests are processed

disabled.description: a disabled change-type does not have any effect but will still log into the PR check logs

restrictive.description: an entity protected with restriced change-type can only be changed by the team that has the change-type assigned

inherit.description: inherit the changes of additional change types

description.description: description of the queries included in the file

path.description: path to resource query to be tested

variables to be used in the test

expectedTargetPath.description: the exected result of target Path

expectedToRender.description: whether the template is expected to render or not

grafanaUrls.description:
List of links to Grafana Dashboard/Folders associated with the service. Please provide
a title together with the link.

sopsUrl.description:
Link to the git repo path that contains the top-level for the service
SOPs.

architectureDocument.description:
The Architecture Document should be written with SREs as the target audience. Anyone
reading the Architecture Document should understand how the service works, even
without any prior background. This document will be the primary reference during
incidents. To ensure the Architecture Document is always accessible to SREs and its
changes properly reviewed and tracked, it must be written in markdown and stored in
a place where SREs can control its changes.

serviceOwners.description: Teams or individuals who is/are responsible for the running instance of the software.

serviceNotifications.description: Teams or individuals who is/are should get notifications related to the service.

provider.description: Reference to a monitoring provider to use for this endpoint

showInReviewQueue.description: Include MRs from this repo in the AppSRE Review Queue

imageBuildUrl.description: URL for the component's image build job (jenkins job, rhtap pipeline page, etc.)

managePermissions.description: should permissions be managed on the repository

items.description: commit sha of this repository that should not be promoted
commit sha of this repository that should be promoted even without being published with success to any subscribed channels

description.description: Long description of the current contract
Long description of the current contract version

secretParameters.description: environment level parameters from vault secrets

jiraComponent.description: component to set on jira tickets

jiraLabels.description: labels to add on jira tickets

imageRef.description: Image ref used by the shard.

subSharding.description: Sub-sharding strategy used by a shard.

disableUnleash.description: disable integration interaction with unleash instance

environmentAware.description: integration is aware of the environment it is running in

extraArgs.description: additional arguments to pass to integration

items.description: additional environment variables to set for the integration

secretName.description: secret name to get environment variable from

secretKey.description: secret key to get value from and to use as the environment variable name

internalCertificates.description: integration requires internal certificates to execute

logs.description: ship logs to providers (cloudwatch is enabled by default)

sleepDurationSecs.description: time to sleep in seconds between integration executions

storageClassName.description: kubernetes storage class name for the cache

concurrencyPolicy.description: how to treat concurrent executions of the integration

successfulJobHistoryLimit.description: number of history records reserved for successful integration executions

failedJobHistoryLimit.description: number of history records reserved for failed integration executions

enablePushgateway.description: push metrics at the end of the run to the configured Pushgateway

inUseBy.description: A reference to some entity that is able to, and has claimed this network. If this network is unclaimed, this will have a null value.

networkAddress.description: The network address in CIDR format

parentNetwork.description: A reference to this network's parent network. If this is a 'root' network, it will have no parent.

public_gpg_key.description:
This PGP Public key will be used to encrypt the users, instead of the users keys.
It is owned by APP-SRE. The field name is not a type as it is consistent with access/user-1.yml schema.

private_pgp_key_vault_path.description: This is the vault path to the private key used for reencryption.

reencrypt_vault_path.description: Base path to read/write pgp encrypted entries from/to.

aws_account_output_vault_path.description: Path to write reencrypted AWS Account passwords to.

skip_aws_accounts.description:
This is kind of a feature flipper. Access requests for AWS accounts listed here will be sent
using the SMTP mail send implementation in terraform-users integration.

retention.description: Describes the amount of builds that will be kept

minimum.description: Minimum amount of builds that will be kept no matter what 'days' says

maximum.description: Maximum amount of builds that will be kept no matter what 'days' says

taskTemplates.description:
Tekton Task jinja2 templates that will be used to create the corresponding
objects in the provider namespace

pipelineTemplates.description:
Tekton Pipeline jinja2 templates that will be used to create the corresponding
objects in the provider namespace. This object defines the types of pipeline
templates that we support. Since they have to be referred from the integration
that triggers the pipeline via a PipelineRun this is actually an object rather
than a list. Properties of this object will be the different pipelines supported
in qontract-reconcile code.

deployResources.description: CPU and memory resources used by the openshift-saas-deploy step of the openshift-saas-deploy tasks created by the openshit-tekton-resources integration

productOwners.description: Teams or individuals who is/are responsible for the running instance of the software.

secretParameters.description: saas file level parameters from vault secrets

validateTargetsInApp.description: indicates a desire to validate that all targets belong to the same app as the saas file itself

validatePlannedData.description: enable skipping planned data validation, mostly for automated bootstrap pusrposes

secretParameters.description: resource template level parameters from vault secrets

deprecated.description: prevent updates to a saas file

timeout.description:
Maximum time the deployment job is allowed to last. In Tekton it defaults to
60 minutes. We don't allow smaller times as Tekton implementation currently deletes
PipelineRun pods, hence destroying logs.

deployResources.description: CPU and memory resources used by the openshift-saas-deploy step of the openshift-saas-deploy tasks created by the openshit-tekton-resources integration

/app-sre/saas-file-authentication-1.yml.description: saas file authentication section for image and/or code credentials

redeployOnPublisherConfigChange.description:
Whether to redeploy if a config change happened in a publisher. This will set
target_config_hash in promotion_data. This is mainly intended for test jobs.

soakDays.description: number of days to wait for promotion

schedule.description: Same as AUS schedule - crontab expression to optionally restrict deployment windows

secretParameters.description: target level parameters from vault secrets

image.description: wait for image to exist before triggering a deployment

SLONamespace.description:
This field is used to determine in which namespace PrometheusRule
object that contain the alerts generated from the expressions of
this SLO document is going to be created. Those alerts are being
used in the slo-to-status-board flow:
https://gitlab.cee.redhat.com/service/app-interface/-/blob/master/docs/status-board/statusboard-alertmanager-receiver.md

If omitted, the rules will be generated in the namespace
observabilityNamespace of the cluster to which the `namespace` of
this SLO document belongs to.

SLISpecification.description: SLI specification, e.g 'The proportion of valid requests served successfully'

SLODetails.description:
Thorough description of this SLO. Do not use a Google doc for this. It must contain
  * SLI description - What do we want to measure
  * SLI rationale -  Why do we want to measure it
  * Implementation details - How do we want to measure it
  * SLO rationale - Why we have chosen the targets
  * Alerting: How we are doing it on top of our SLIs/SLOs

SLOTargetUnit.description:
Unit in which the 'expr' and 'SLOTarget' will be expressed:
  * Use 'percentage_0_1' if the your PromQL query is going to return values for 0 to 1
  * Use 'percentage_0_100' if the your PromQL query is going to return values for 0 to 100

expr.description:
Prometheus expression to calculate the SLO. It should be expressed
in the units of the 'SLOTargetUnit'. It will be processed with jinja,
with the SLOParameters as input.

SLOTarget.description: SLO target. It should be expressed by means of the 'SLOTargetUnit' field

prometheusRules.description:
Location of the prometheus rules associated to this SLO definition
(currently only a path in app-interface)

prometheusRulesTests.description: Location of the prometheus rules tests for the prometheus rules

/app-sre/tekton-pipeline-template-1.yml.description:
Properties of tekton pipeline templates deployed in tekton pipelines providers
namespaces

name.description:
One per namespace file Template name. It is limited in size as the tekton
object name is limited to 63 characters

One per saas file Template name. It is very limited in size as the tekton
pipeline final name will also contain the saas file and the max size of
a pipeline is limited to 63 characters.

But we impose another restriction, because pipeline retries generate a
pipeline run that appends 7 characters to the pipeline name. Since pipeline
runs also have a 63 character limit, this limits pipeline names to 56
characters, which finally limits the pipeline names to 15. See all the
details in the openshift-tekton-resources integration.

/app-sre/tekton-task-template-1.yml.description:
Properties of tekton task templates deployed in tekton pipelines providers
namespaces

name.description:
One per namespace file Template name. It is limited in size as the tekton
task name is limited to 63 characters

One per saas file Template name. It is very limited in size as the tekton
object final name will also contain the saas file and the total size is
limited to 63 characters

allowUnmanagedFeatureToggles.description: Set to true to allow unmanaged/manually created feature toggles

name.description: The name of the security contact.

title.description: The title of the security contact. Default use the name.

automationRole.description: Role per integration or use-case to assume in the account

awsAccountManager.description: The AWS account manager IAM role name in the payer account

integrations.description: integrations to disable for the aws account

partition.description: the partition used in ARNs in the account (arn:aws:...)

terraformState.description: key information for a terraform's state location and integration

rosa.description: Rosa related attributes in the aws account.

billingAccount.description: AWS account to be used as the Billing account for ROSA HCP cluster provisioning

sso.description: Enable single sign on for the account. Default is enabled.

alias.description: The alias for the account. This is the name that appears in the AWS SSO page. If not set, the account name will be used.

items.description: AWS quota limits for this account
Initial AWS quota limits for this account

uid.description:
Specifying an account UID will takeover an existing account instead of creating a new one.
Please make sure you specify the current account owner and the current organization.

additionalFeatures.description: Enable/disable additional features for this account. See account template for all available feature options.

/aws/cleanup-option-1.yml.description: Define cleanup options of AWS objects.

regex.description: Regex expression to filter items by.

age.description: AMI age from which we can consider deletion.

delete_empty_log_group.description: Enable deletion when log group is empty.

apply_immediately.description: Specifies whether any modifications are applied immediately, or during the next maintenance window.

at_rest_encryption_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable encryption at rest.

auto_minor_version_upgrade.description: Specifies whether minor engine upgrades are applied automatically to the cache cluster during the maintenance window.

automatic_failover_enabled.description: Specifies whether a read-only replica is automatically promoted to read/write primary if the existing primary fails.

availability_zones.description: List of Availability Zones in which cache nodes are created. terraform attribute: preferred_cache_cluster_azs

cluster_mode.description: Enables data partitioning across distinct nodes in a Redis (cluster mode enabled) replication group.

num_node_groups.description: The number of node groups (shards) for this Redis replication group. Terraform attribute: num_node_groups

replicas_per_node_group.description: An optional parameter that specifies the number of replica nodes in each node group (shard). Terraform attribute: replicas_per_node_group

engine.description: The name of the cache engine to be used for the cache clusters in this replication group.

engine_version.description: The version number of the cache engine to be used for the cache clusters in this replication group.

items.description: Specifies the destination and format of Redis SLOWLOG or Redis Engine Log

maintenance_window.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur. Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi

multi_az_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable Multi-AZ Support for the replication group

node_type.description: Instance class for the cache cluster. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/red-ug/CacheNodes.SupportedTypes.html

notification_topic_arn.description: ARN of an SNS topic to send ElastiCache notifications to.

number_cache_clusters.description: The number of cache clusters (primary and replicas) in this replication group. Terraform attribute: num_cache_clusters

parameter_group_name.description: The name of the parameter group to associate with this replication group. If this argument is omitted, the default cache parameter group for the specified engine is used.

port.description: The port number on which each of the cache nodes accepts connections. Default: 6379

replication_group_description.description: The replication group description. Default: 'elasticache cluster'

security_group_ids.description: List of security group IDs to associate with this replication group.

snapshot_retention_limit.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache retains automatic cache cluster snapshots before deleting them. For zero (0), backups are turned off.

snapshot_window.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache begins taking a daily snapshot of the node group. Minimum a 60 minute period. Format: hh24:mi-hh24:mi

subnet_group_name.description: The name of the cache subnet group to be used for the replication group.

transit_encryption_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable encryption in transit.

transit_encryption_mode.description: Specifies whether to use encryption in transit for the replication group.

master_user_secret.description:
Secret containing the user/password authentication data. It must only
contain the "master_user_name" and "master_user_password" keys

admin_user_arn.description:
The ARN for the admin user.
This option is mutually exclusive with admin_user_credentials.

admin_user_credentials.description:
Secret containing the user/password authentication data. It must only
contain the "master_user_name" and "master_user_password" keys.
The admin user password must be at least 8 chars long, contain at least one
uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.
This option is mutually exclusive with admin_user_arn.

ou.description: AWS organizational unit. Use path to the OU, e.g. /Root/OrgUnit1/Foo/Bar

mandatory.description: is policy mandatory in the account

serviceCode.description: Specifies the service identifier. To find the service code value for an Amazon Web Services service, use the ListServices operation.

quotaCode.description: Specifies the quota identifier. To find the quota code for a specific quota, use the ListServiceQuotas operation, and look for the QuotaCode response in the output for the quota you want.

value.description: Specifies the new, increased value for the quota.

regex.description: regex expression to filter items by

ref.description: commit SHA, not a branch like main or master

delete.description: set to true to delete the repo

name.description: Name of the repository to filter.

tags.description:
This limits which tags to mirror to the ones in the list.
They will take preference over the ones excluded.
Regular expressions are supported.

tagsExclude.description: Tags to exclude. Regular expression are supported.

status.description:
a list of providers that can influence the status of this
status page component

prometheusAlerts.description: config options for the 'prometheus-alerts' status provider

matchers.description:
a list of prometheus alert matchers (alertname and labels) and a
corresponding status that should be applied to a component if such
a metric was found

alert.description: the alert name to match on

labels.description: the alert labels to match on

componentStatus.description:
the status to apply to the status page component if this a
matching prometheus alert was found

manual.description: config options for the 'manual' status provider

componentStatus.description: the status to apply to the status page component

from.description: an optional start date to activate this provider

until.description: an optional start date to deactivate this provider

integrations.description: holds information which bucket key stores the terraform state per integration

name.description: The name of the project. For open-source Unleash it must be "default"!

Name used in the Dynatrace API as prefix for token.
Note, that due to Dynatrace API the token name length is limited.

keyNameInSecret.description: Key for this token inside the openshift secret object. If not set, uses "name"

outputs_secret_image.description: Docker image to use for the outputs secret container

outputs_secret_version.description: Version of the outputs secret container to use

outputs_secret_image.description: Docker image to use for the outputs secret container

outputs_secret_version.description: Version of the outputs secret container to use

outputs_secret_image.description: Docker image to use for the outputs secret container

outputs_secret_version.description: Version of the outputs secret container to use

enableDeadMansSnitch.description: Flag to automate snitch creation/deletion by deadmanssnitch integration

enableCostReport.description: Flag to enable openshift cost report

private.description: kube API (load balancer) and router is private, access require peering

subnet_ids.description: Hosted Clusters only: list of subnet_ids to use with the cluster creation.

availability_zones.description: Hosted Clusters only: list of availability_zones to use with the cluster creation.

allowPrivateHcpApiAccess.description:
if set to true, enable traffic from attached TGW to reach the API and oauth server
of a private HCP by adapting the VPC endpoint security group

manageAccountRoutes.description:
historically, account-vpc did not have support for managing routes on the aws side.
instead of re-using manageRoutes, this is a backwards compatible field for managing such routes.
once all account-vpc connections that have manageRoutes also have manageAccountRoutes,
we can consolidate to use managedRoutes only.

cidrBlocks.description: the list of cidr blocks to route through this transit gateway

clusterAdmin.description: should enable cluster admin for this cluster

internal.description: the cluster is attached to the transit gateway to the VPN, only private cluster can be internal

dtp.description: request dynatrace-token-provider to issue a token for the cluster

tenant.description: dynatrace tenant id to issue tokens for

token-spec.description: name of the DTP token-spec to use for this cluster

mutexes.description:
list of named upgrade mutex locks for this cluster. A cluster needs
to acquire all its mutex locks in order to be upgraded. A mutex lock
can be held by only one cluster at a time.

sector.description:
The sector which the cluster is part of. Sector dependencies are
defined in openshift-cluster-manager-1.yml. A cluster will be
upgraded to a version only if clusters in previous sectors are
running that version or higher.

blockedVersions.description:
List of versions that will be rejected for upgrades.
They can be regular expressions"

managedExternalResources.description: are external resources managed for this namespace

externalResources.description: external resources to provision for this namespace

orgId.description:
The internal OCM organization ID that can be found via
ocm whoami | jq .organization.id

addonUpgradeTests.description: trigger a job in jenkins following an addon upgrade

recommendedVersion.description: Recommended version for provisioning new clusters

initialVersion.description: Initial version string, as used by the OCM API

workload.description: Workload the version is recommended for

channel.description: Channel version can be found, stable if not set

majority.description: most used version currently running that workload

highest.description: highest version currently running that workload

blockedVersions.description: List of versions that will be rejected for upgrades. They can be regular expressions

upgradePolicyAllowedWorkloads.description: List of workloads that are allowed to be defined as cluster upgrade policy workload

upgradePolicyAllowedMutexes.description: List of mutexes that are allowed to be defined as cluster upgrade policy mutex

ausClusterHealthChecks.description: List of cluster health check providers

sectors.description: List of allowed deployment sectors and their dependencies

dependencies.description: list of sectors this one is depending on

upgradePolicyDefaults.description: List of default upgrade policies to apply to clusters by external configuration labels

upgradePolicyClusters.description: List of clusters to define upgrade policies for (no cluster management in such OCM orgs)

inheritVersionData.description: list of OCM organizations from which we will retrieve cluster version informations (current versions stats, soak days, sectors, ..).

publishVersionData.description: list of OCM organizations to which we will publish cluster version informations (current versions stats, soak days, sectors, ..)

integrations.description: integrations to disable for the ocm organization

enable_query_support.description: indicates that this resource is using graphql query results
indicates that this resource is using graphql query results
indicates that this resource is using graphql query results
indicates that this resource is using graphql query results

/openshift/resource-requests-requirement.description:
CPU and memory resources requirements to be set in pods requests
configuration

provider.description:
the provider defines the method of formatting the terraform output
into a secret. a provider can declare additional configuration data to
get the job done or define the format directly

data.description:
the data to use for the secret. the field values can use the
terraform output variables as jinja2 placeholders

state.description: List items must never be removed. To signal that a list item should be deleted the state should be set to deleted and downstream integrations will remove the corresponding object if it exists.

__identifier.description: this is the field that holds the context uniqueness hash for a crossref. it is managed by qontract-bundler during the bundling process if a crossref datafile defines at least one isContextUnique field

statusPageStatus.description: a list of supported status page component status

dhmsDuration.description: The format is a subset of Go's ParseDuration format, only allowing from days to seconds in resolution, e.g. '1h', '1d1h1m2s', ...

path.description: A path is a string that starts with a forward slash and contains only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, spaces, and underscores. It does not end with a slash.

phoneNumber.description: A phone number is a string that starts with a plus sign followed by a country code and a phone number.

date.description: A date is a string in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
